content: On November 23, 1990, the Atlanta Braves made a significant trade that would impact the franchise for years to come. They acquired outfielder David Justice from the New York Yankees in exchange for pitcher Dale Murphy. Justice would go on to become a key player in the Braves' success during the 1990s, helping the team win the World Series in 1995 and earning the 1990 Rookie of the Year honors. This trade marked a pivotal moment in the Braves' transformation into a championship contender.
